Title: Sr. Engineering Program Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
You will be joining a company that creates positivity, community, and fitness with technology. This individual will be based in the Taipei office and report to the US based Hardware EPM Director in Product Development. You will be responsible for leading programs from prototype to launch of Connected Fitness Products. You will work closely with Product Management, Industrial Design, Engineering, Software, Quality and Operations. The ideal candidate has incredible organization skills and is able to get things done with timeliness and autonomy while building strong teams.

Collaborate with leads from Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, Industrial Design, Product Management, Quality, and Operations to create detailed and comprehensive program plans.

 YOU BRING TO PELOTON


You are self-motivated, willing to take action, pragmatic, and intellectually curious.


Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related experience.


8+ years experience with Hardware Program Management in consumer electronics, fitness equipment, appliances or automobiles.


Experience in working with Asia suppliers: ODM, CM, JDM.


Managed multiple product development cycles for a hardware complex system with cross functional dependencies.


Detailed understanding of the Product Development Process and broad understanding of the supply chain and manufacturing processes.


Leadership skills and ability to influence and inspire team members.


Excellent communicator with the ability to translate complex technical issues or ideas to a wider audience.


Able to foster and build a collaborative working relationship with various stakeholders.

Title: Talent Producer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
The Talent Producer is responsible for providing creative support and assistance to an assigned group of Peloton Instructors. This role involves working closely with Instructors to help shape and produce high-quality classes and content for Pelotons various platforms. The Talent Producer will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Programming, Music, and Social Media, to deliver content that aligns with Pelotons brand standards and resonates with the audience. 
Talent Producers typically support Instructors with a mix of experiences as on camera and multichannel talent. Talent Producers will on average support 3-5 Instructors that teach 1-4 fitness modalities.
This role involves a focus on providing hands-on support in content creation, assisting with execution, and ensuring the overall vision of each class is met.
While the Talent Producer will contribute to creative processes, this role is focused on production support, content development and delivery. It is an ideal position for someone looking to grow within Pelotons fast-paced environment, with opportunities for learning and development in creative production and talent management.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON
Content Development & Execution:

Pre-Production Support: Assist in providing support to assigned Instructors by preparing class plans, scripts, and creative briefs to ensure alignment with Pelotons standards and the Instructors voice.
Creative Assistance: Contribute ideas for class themes, social media content, and promotional materials. Help pitch and develop creative concepts for their talent for all channels as related to Peloton.
Research & Collaboration: Assist in conducting research for content development and work with the Music team to ensure the appropriate selection and integration of music into class plans.
Content Execution: Collaborate with the Studio Producer team during content execution, ensuring smooth production processes. Support the team with any edits or adjustments as needed, and ensure the content aligns with production guidelines.

Feedback & Instructor Support:

Class Support: Attend and/or review Instructors' live or recorded classes to offer constructive feedback, ensuring the final content aligns with Pelotons production standards.
Social Strategy Support: Help develop strategies for enhancing Instructors' social media presence and brand. Work closely with the Social Media team to ensure consistent messaging across platforms.
Class Clips & Social Content: Assist in identifying and capturing key moments from classes to be used on Pelotons social media channels, ensuring that the content is aligned with Pelotons overall brand messaging.

Programming & Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Programming Support: Work with the Programming team to ensure Instructors class schedules are well-balanced and that content diversity is maintained. Support programming strategies to optimize Instructor performance.
Content Development & Protocols: Assist in the creation of production protocols for new classes and content, ensuring adherence to Pelotons fitness standards in collaboration with Fitness Development and Training teams.

Creative Producer Lead:

As assigned, provide support for cross-functional concepts, collaborating with their team and team leaders to execute ideas from start to finish. This ranges from individual Instructor concepts to medium to large content initiatives.
Talent Producers will also be captains of fitness programming initiatives, driving creative support in partnership with Talent Producers & Instructors. Examples of fitness programming subjects are launching new class types, new fitness areas of interest

 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Experience: At least 24 years of experience in production, broadcast, or creative roles, preferably in a content creation environment. Experience working with on-camera talent is beneficial.
Education: Bachelors degree in Journalism, Communications, Media Production, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
Creative & Editorial Skills: Strong writing, research, and editorial skills. Ability to assist with creative ideas and help execute content development with attention to detail.
Fitness & Production Knowledge: While formal fitness qualifications are not required, a basic understanding of Pelotons fitness modalities and production protocols is helpful. A strong interest in fitness content is essential.
Technical & Social Media Savvy: Familiarity with social media platforms and content editing tools. Knowledge of how to create engaging, shareable content for various platforms is a plus.
Personal Qualities: Strong communication skills, attention to detail, and a collaborative mindset. Ability to work in a fast-paced, creative environment while remaining organized and proactive.

 
Work Environment & Requirements:

Based at either the New York, with a requirement to be in the office at least 3 days per week. Additional days or weekend work may be required based on team or business needs.
Must be willing to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends, and holidays, as needed to accommodate production schedules.

Title: Manager, Strategic Finance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a passionate and motivated Strategic Finance Manager to support the business with thoughtful financial analysis and to drive strategic decision-making. This role sits within Pelotons broader Financial, Planning and Analysis (FP&A) team and reports to the teams Senior Director, FP&A.
YOUR IMPACT AT PELOTON

Through ad hoc, creative financial modeling, you will help senior leaders assess complex topics across various aspects of Pelotons business, including Corporate Development & Strategic Partnerships, Product Development, Content Production, Sales & Marketing, Operations and more. 
You will help senior management define the Companys strategic priorities by working closely with Pelotons Strategy & Business Operations team and leaders across the organization.
You will support Pelotons Long Range Planning efforts by incorporating our strategic goals to a multi-year financial plan, leveraging scenario analysis to identify risks and opportunities and to align our resources with long-term goals.
You will be the Finance business partner to the Strategic Partnerships and Corporate Development team, providing end-to-end support across the lifecycle of a deal and maintaining the teams P&L forecasting and reporting. This includes evaluating potential M&A and Strategic Partnership opportunities by performing financial due diligence and valuation analysis. 
You will collaborate with various cross-functional teams on an ad hoc basis to provide financial modeling and analysis support to answer complex business questions. 
You will support the evolution of Pelotons capital allocation strategy and execute capital markets transactions.
You may assist in preparation of Board of Directors and quarterly Investor Relations materials.

 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

You have 5+ years of experience across Strategic Finance, FP&A, Corporate Development, Private Equity and/or Investment Banking. Experience with M&A and Capital Markets transactions is preferred.
You demonstrate high proficiency and enthusiasm for complex problem-solving with financial modeling and analysis.
You possess strong communication and presentation skills, capable of concisely presenting complex analyses to senior leaders.
You are a proactive and a highly organized self-starter, able to work independently and under tight deadlines while maintaining attention to detail.
You have the ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.

Title: Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer will be working with the Peloton Quality and broader Operations teams to drive improvements and support in the management of quality processes and quality management systems at our manufacturing partners facilities. You will work with our partners to drive process control improvements ensuring that only qualified parts and processes are used to build our products.  This will be done by evaluating that they are following best practices for inspection, providing root cause and corrective action guidance and by integrating with their teams to help identify and execute data driven process enhancements and improvements. You have the technical ability, problem solving skills, and communication skills to solve issues on the factory floor and with the Peloton technical team. Youll act as the first line of defense to improve our product and processes. You are an individual who is independent, highly motivated, super organized, hyper-flexible and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment to improve total product quality. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Quality Systems: Maintain and improve company quality management systems (QMS) in compliance with applicable regulatory & Peloton requirements related to control of processes and product.
Management: Responsible for representing overseas quality team onsite, training, and ongoing support of staff. Required to effectively communicate project goals to Suppliers. Provide technical guidance and training (mentorship) to suppliers to their ongoing development to reach company goals. manage supplier audit program and suggest new suppliers to audit.
Product Development: Be a key member of the Peloton product development team onsite representing the Supplier Quality function. Steer and support the design control aspects of product quality, program management, and quality planning from product design through manufacturing. Assess, support and process supplier approvals and re-approvals in the approved supplier list (ASL).
Process Verification and Validation: Provide input regarding appropriate statistical methods, test facilities and equipment. This can include process validation, equipment installation/operational qualification, etc.
Production: May develop and implement quality inspection procedures including sampling plans, for production level components, sub-assemblies and finished goods. May also be responsible for the development and implementation of inspection methodologies, fixtures, measurement systems and calibration of such. Monitor, support and resolve production related quality issues with materialsuppliers.
Auditing: Responsible for overall audit program execution. Developing, implementing, and auditing risk-based annual quality control audit plans and schedules. Conduct and lead supplier, internal and external GMP(Good Manufacturing Practice) and ISO compliance audits. supports production line qualification initiatives, continuous improvement, and regulatory compliance across all supplier sites. Reports results and recommendations for changes as required. Confirms acceptable follow up action on audits. RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, the Learning and Development team empowers individuals to thrive by creating learning experiences that foster growth, longevity, and professional joy, enabling everyone to perform their best. 
We are seeking a highly organized and tech-savvy Learning Technology and Operations Specialist to join our dynamic Learning & Development team. This role is the backbone of our learning ecosystem, ensuring smooth program execution and a seamless learning experience. Reporting to the Director of Learning and Development, the ideal candidate combines technical systems administration skills with hands-on coordination process.
You will manage our Learning Management System (LMS) daily and provide critical operational support for training initiatives, from preparation and logistics to co-facilitation and community engagement. If you are ready to enhance our team members' learning experiences, apply now!
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 
Learning Management System (LMS) Administration (50%)

Serve as the primary administrator and technical point of contact for the company's Learning Management System, Seismic.
Manage all aspects of the LMS, including course creation, user enrollment, audience management, and permissions.
Upload, test, and deploy various learning content, including SCORM-compliant eLearning, videos, documents, and assessments.
Generate and analyze data to create insightful reports and dashboards on learning activity, course completion rates, and program effectiveness.
Provide timely and friendly technical support to end-users, troubleshooting and resolving LMS-related issues.
Manage system updates, conduct regular maintenance, and collaborate with the LMS vendor to resolve complex issues and explore new features.
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of all learning data within the system.

Learning Operations & Coordination (50%)

Coordinate all logistics for virtual and in-person training sessions, including scheduling, calendar invitations, room/virtual meeting setup, and roster management.
Prepare, organize, and distribute digital and physical training materials (e.g., workbooks, slide decks, pre-work assignments).
Act as a producer or co-facilitator for virtual instructor-led training sessions. Responsibilities include managing breakout rooms, launching polls, monitoring chat, and assisting participants with technical challenges.
Support learning exercises and activities during training sessions to drive engagement and reinforce learning objectives.
Serve as a key point of contact for employees and managers with questions about learning programs, schedules, and enrollment.
Administer post-training surveys and compile feedback to help the L&D team measure program impact and identify areas for improvement.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

2-3+ years of experience in a Learning & Development, HR Operations, or similar role.
Direct hands-on experience administering a Learning Management System, ideally with Seismic. Must be comfortable with technology and able to learn new systems quickly.
Exceptional attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and tasks under tight deadlines.
Experience running learning reports, utilizing dashboards, and analyzing data.
Familiarity with content authoring tools (e.g., Articulate 360, Vyond).
Basic understanding of instructional design principles and adult learning theory.
Proven experience as a producer or co-facilitator for virtual training.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with a customer-centric mindset.
Proficiency with Google Suite (Slides, Docs, Sheets) and Zoom.

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking an experienced Senior Manager, Member Support Operations to join our globally diverse and talented team working from our Peloton Plano Headquarters. This is a critical leadership role within our Global Member Support organization, ideal for someone who thrives in a high-volume, fast paced environment and is passionate about delivering a best in class Member experience.  
In this role, you will oversee the day-to-day execution and delivery of frontline service operations, ensuring operational rigor, performance consistency, and a culture of excellence across your team.  Youll be accountable for driving key performance metrics, optimizing workflows, and partnering cross-functionally to solve complex business challenges while ensuring every Member interaction reflects Pelotons high standards.  
This role supports a team of hourly team members and people leaders.  It requires a dynamic and data-driven leader with experience leading at scale in a contact center environment. This role will additionally partner with our business partners (BPOs) to ensure a consistent approach and sharing of knowledge across the network.   
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Operational Leadership: Provide tactical direction and oversight to the contact center team to ensure consistent service delivery aligned with Pelotons goals.
Executive Escalation Management: Lead the strategy, execution, and resolution of high-visibility, executive-level escalations, ensuring swift, accurate, and empathetic responses that protect Pelotons brand reputation.
BPO Partnership & Alignment: Build deep, trust-based partnerships with our BPO network, maintaining a strong understanding of their operations to drive consistency, performance alignment, and shared accountability across all sites.
Performance Management: Drive accountability through data-driven coaching and a results-based performance culture.
Process Optimization: Identify and implement improvements that enhance contact center efficiency, reduce friction, and improve first contact resolution.
Team Development: Lead, coach, and mentor a team of managers and supervisors, fostering continuous development and engagement.
Workforce Planning: Partner with Workforce and Real Time Analyst teams to ensure proper staffing, scheduling, and service level adherence.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Align with key internal teams (Product, Logistics, Engineering, Legal, Security, etc.) to resolve escalations and improve support processes.
Member Advocacy: Champion the Member voice, using insights to remove barriers and improve the end-to-end experience.
Recruitment & Culture: Support hiring, onboarding, and retention efforts while contributing to a positive, inclusive, and high-performing call center culture.
Strategic Execution: Translate business priorities into operational plans with a bias for action and measurable outcomes.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Contact Center Expertise: 5+ years of leadership experience in a contact center or customer support environment, preferably in a medium-to-large, multi-site, or BPO supported environment.  
People Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead, inspire, and develop high-performing frontline and leadership teams.
Operational Depth: Strong knowledge of contact center best practices, including workforce management, quality assurance, service recovery, fraud and dispute experience and KPI optimization.
Data-Driven Mindset: Ability to analyze trends, manage metrics (AHT, FCR, CSAT, etc.), and take action based on insights.
Strategic Agility: Comfortable managing ambiguity and translating business strategy into frontline execution.
Effective Communication: Strong written and verbal communication skills; experienced in presenting to senior leadership and frontline audiences.
Continuous Improvement: Passion for process improvement, innovation, and delivering exceptional service experiences.
Resilience and Flexibility: Adaptable in a rapidly evolving environment with competing priorities and complex workflows.

Title: Sr. Director, Communications, Product and Technology
RoleDescription:
Peloton is seeking a strategic and highly connected Senior Director of Product Communications to lead the external communications strategy for our growing portfolio of consumer hardware and digital technology products. Reporting directly to the Chief Communications Officer, this individual will serve as the companys communications lead for all product-related announcements, innovation narratives, and milestone moments. This is a high-visibility leadership role that will shape how Peloton's groundbreaking products are perceived in the market - both by consumers and industry influencers.
You will oversee integrated product communications across software, hardware, and digital platforms. You will work closely with executive leadership, including product, design, engineering, marketing, and talent brand to create and execute world-class go-to-market communications strategies. A critical component of this role will be cultivating relationships with top-tier consumer and technology press, think The Verge, WIRED, Fast Company, and TechCrunch, and securing marquee moments and speaking opportunities that place Pelotons innovations and leaders at the forefront of the industry.
You are an exceptional storyteller, experienced in bringing complex technology products to life for broad consumer audiences. You are just as comfortable briefing a top-tier tech journalist as you are preparing a C-level executive for a global product launch. You bring a track record of successfully leading communications for major launches and driving coverage that shapes public perception.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Develop and lead global product communications strategy for Pelotons connected fitness, software, and digital product innovations.
Serve as a trusted strategic advisor to executive leadership, particularly across product and engineering, helping shape and articulate the companys innovation story.
Own the media strategy and execution for all product announcements, launches, and innovation milestones - securing impactful coverage that positions Peloton as a category leader.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with top-tier media, influencers, and analysts across consumer tech, innovation, and lifestyle verticals.
Identify and secure high-impact speaking opportunities and industry stages (e.g., CES, SXSW, Wired25) for Peloton executives and technical leaders.
Oversee development of all product comms materials including press releases, talking points, media pitches, blog content, and executive bylines.
Lead agency and vendor partnerships to scale campaign execution, story amplification, and product storytelling.
Collaborate cross-functionally with internal communications, product marketing, investor relations, legal, and brand teams to ensure consistency and alignment across all public messaging.
Monitor industry trends and competitive activity, providing insights and recommendations to leadership.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in communications, with significant experience leading product and technology PR in-house or at top-tier agencies; experience launching high-profile consumer tech or hardware products is required.
Strong relationships with leading tech and business media, with a portfolio of impactful placements in outlets like The Verge, WIRED, Fast Company, TechCrunch, Bloomberg, and others.
Proven experience crafting and leading complex, multi-channel launch strategies for consumer technology products.
Exceptional leadership and interpersonal skills, with experience managing high-performing teams and working cross-functionally with senior leaders.
Demonstrated ability to manage complex situations, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills; writing samples required.
Experience working with or within a product or engineering organization is a strong plus.
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field; advanced degree a plus.

Title: Sr. Tooling Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Senior Tooling Engineer is a crucial position for optimizing the tooling development from tooling design to production sustaining with JDMs (Joint Development Manufacturer), ODMs (Original Design Manufacturer) and CMs (Contract Manufacturers) with consideration in both throughput and quality, while also advice on optimizing part & assembly design for manufacturing (DFM) with internal design and engineering team. An ideal candidate should have hands-on experiences with hydroforming tooling, metallic tooling and process design and/or tool trial trouble shooting on site. Experienced with injection toolings, overmolding techniques, rubber forming, progressive dies, stage dies, transfer dies, tool steel selection, deep draw, high speed stamping, forging, surface coating, surface finish processing and heat treating are important traits of an ideal candidate as well.
To ensure the quality delivery of the program, the Senior Tooling Engineer is responsible for several key tasks. These include drafting supplier-facing tooling requirements and maintenance plans, which will be based on both product demand and design specifications. The engineer will also gather tooling information to populate company asset databases. Furthermore, the role involves active participation in tool trial activities and conducting supplier capability studies to guarantee tool quality. To support the company's long-term growth, the Tooling Engineer will be responsible for developing a knowledge library for advanced materials and fabrication, contributing tooling input for product design requirements, and building simulation models for tooling and part cost analysis.
The Senior Tooling Engineer will not only provide day-to-day technical support for internal teams and JDMs/ODMs/CMs, including engineering changes implementation on tooling, part availability tracking and schedule discussion and cost reduction but also continuous improvement in both quality and time, hands-on implementation of the improvements in the production lines for ensuring manufacturing activities. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to ensure robust DFM/DFA, providing expertise in material & process selection, tooling design and material requirement, process audit and tooling qualification plan
Lead and direct the tooling team, ensuring all tooling across JDMs, ODMs, and CMs consistently meets or exceeds performance, quality, and efficiency goals. This includes design review, approval, maintenance, calibration, and end-of-life considerations for optimized manufacturing.
Engage in detailed technical discussions about part fabrication, manufacturing processes, material selection, and potential challenges. Determine appropriate manufacturing processes to achieve desired cosmetic and functional requirements, considering tolerances, surface finishes, and production
Validate tooling designs, including continuous discussions with suppliers/tool makers and CAE simulations for troubleshooting.
Work with ODMs and CMs to provide engineering support in problem solving and root cause analysis that are tooling related, then understand and help refining technical requirements for products and processes for future and on-going productions
Manages and establishes tooling maintenance standards at vendor sites. Conducts tooling audits to ensure quality of maintenance.
Conduct on-site supplier audits to analyze factory capacity and capability. Collaborate with suppliers on equipment recommendations, conduct financial payback analyses, and submit Capital Expenditure requests to management.
Voice of Peloton manufacturing on cross-functional teams for aligning engineering requirements with manufacturing feasibility
Proposes and identifies innovative applications for existing Peloton materials, products, and processes.
Identify cost reduction opportunities for continuous improvement initiatives involving daily operations, engineering, and processing

 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Bachelors degree or equivalent to demonstrate understanding of Engineering principles is required. Mechanical or mold and die tooling is preferred.
8+ years of engineering and tooling experience in a hands-on manufacturing environment is required (NPI to volume MFG MP stage)
5+ years of leadership experience is preferred
Excellent understanding of moldflow analysis application (injection molding and die casting preferred)
Good communication skills for ensuring engineering requirements are properly met at JDM/ODM/CM
Assuring tooling outcomes fulfilling program management requirements for supporting timely product launch purposes
Expertise in process development and quality control of highly cosmetic components highly regarded.
Valued expertise in cosmetic component process development and quality control, proficient in fabrication processes including sheet metal (hydroforming, stamping), CNC machining, complex assembly, welding, surface finishing, and post-processes (heat treating, plating, anodizing, milling, polishing, grinding).
Profound experiences in resolving tooling issues for assuring mass production
Good interpretation on engineering drawings, tolerances, GD&T
Software applications, CAD (SolidWorks preferred)/CAE
Flexibility to travel domestically and internationally 30% or more as needed

Title: Localisation Project Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Pelotons Content Department, comprising our Production, Studio Operations and Instructor teams, works 365 days a year to deliver a broad offering of highly-engaging subscription content to our members. We are a highly collaborative, fast-moving department that focuses on evolving our innovative programming. 
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Localisation Project Manager to support our localisation efforts, ensuring the highest quality and cultural relevance of our content for international markets. This role will be pivotal in shaping our localisation strategy, optimising AI-first workflows, managing vendor relationships, and critically, evaluating the performance of AI models specifically used for subtitling. The ideal candidate will possess a strong blend of linguistic expertise, project management skills, and a keen understanding of AI's application in the localisation landscape.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Oversee the end-to-end localisation lifecycle, liaise with Pelotons localisation partners, and ensure the timely and right-first-time delivery of high-quality localised content to Members. 
Manage multiple localisation projects concurrently, prioritising tasks and mitigating risks.
Implement and optimise localisation workflows, leveraging industry best practices and technology.
Recruit, train and manage high-performing freelance Linguists to support QC efforts.
Organise the evaluation of translation output from Machine Translation and other AI technologies, and provide feedback to Engineering teams.
Create, maintain and expand language assets, including glossaries, guides and playbooks, and contribute to the establishment of cross-functional localisation best practices.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders, providing expertise and support, and communicating clearly on day-to-day operational activities.
Monitor the Member Support channels and resolve any captioning or localisation issues.
Monitor the relevant localisation performance data boards and report on the health status of captioning and localisation operations.
Liaise with our translation technology partners, suggest new features, resolve issues, and ensure smooth operation of the service.
Select, onboard, and manage external localisation vendors (LSPs, freelance linguists) to ensure consistent quality and performance.
Design and implement robust evaluation methodologies for AI-generated subtitles, assessing accuracy, fluency, cultural appropriateness, and readability.
Work closely with AI/Machine Learning teams to provide detailed linguistic feedback and identify areas for model improvement.
Analyse performance metrics (e.g., BLEU, TER, COMET, human evaluation scores) to gauge the effectiveness of AI models in subtitling workflows.
Conduct A/B testing and comparative analyses of different AI models or AI-human hybrid approaches for subtitling.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI for natural language processing and subtitling, recommending new tools and approaches.
Track and report on key localisation metrics, including quality, cost, and turnaround time.
Provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders for continuous improvement and strategic decision-making.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Expert knowledge of localisation processes.
Experience as a Localisation Project Manager or Producer.
Fluent English; native speaker of another major European language.
Experience with evaluating language AI technologies (MT, AI), or post-editing AI-generated translations.
Ambition and the courage to explore new ideas in order to develop innovative solutions and work efficiently.
Strong coordination skills, with the ability to handle pressure and be efficient when delivering to tight deadlines.
Proven experience in ownership and maintenance of language assets.
Friendly and credible personality who inspires trust in partners and colleagues.
Flexibility and a positive can-do approach that builds team spirit.
Ability to work independently and unsupervised on projects and report findings to management.
Demonstrated ability to set priorities and meet deadlines.
Experience working in agile and fast-paced environments.
Focus on detail and the end-user experience.
Proactive attitude and a sense of urgency.
Solution-driven thinking.
Must be able to work collaboratively and across cultures. 
Exceptional organisational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while adapting to changing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
Good vendor management skills.
Experience with (AI-) dubbing workflows is advantageous

Capably navigate challenging and sensitive situations, ensuring all matters are handled with objectivity, consistency, and a commitment to fairness.
Synthesize and analyze data, trends, and opportunities from various internal systems to facilitate proactive risk mitigation, early issue resolution, and improve organizational health.
Partner effectively and collaboratively with business leaders and People Business Partners across the organization to implement systemic solutions and foster positive employee relations.
Develop and deliver impactful employee relations training programs for team members and people leaders.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As the Senior Manager, Global Payroll, you'll be the cornerstone of our payroll operations, responsible for the accurate, compliant, and timely processing of payroll for our domestic and international employee base. This role will report to the VP, Finance Transformation & Technology and is based at our headquarters in New York City. You'll be a strategic leader in driving continuous improvement, leveraging technology, and establishing best practices across our global payroll ecosystem. This highly visible role serves as the primary subject matter expert and escalation point for all payroll-related matters, demanding exceptional attention to detail, proactive problem-solving, and a commitment to providing outstanding service to our employees and internal stakeholders.

Compliance & Risk Management: Ensure strict adherence to all internal company policies, SOX requirements, and country-specific, federal, and state regulations, including wage and hour laws and taxation. Proactively identify, track, and resolve potential payroll-related issues and risks, escalating complex matters to senior management as needed.
Process Excellence & Automation: Lead initiatives to identify, develop, and implement process standardization, automation, and continuous improvements across global payroll operations, driving efficiency and scalability to support the companys continued evolution.
Cross-Functional Partnership: Act as the primary payroll liaison, collaborating closely with Accounting (for GL reporting and reconciliations), People Systems, Legal, and other internal partners to establish and maintain best practices for global payroll.
Systems & Integrations: Drive the project management for global payroll service implementations, system integrations (e.g., HRIS, time & attendance, equity platforms), and other related technology initiatives.
Reporting & Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis, generate comprehensive payroll reports, and provide data-driven insights to support decision-making for the People and Finance teams on special projects aimed at streamlining processes and improving procedures.
Subject Matter Expertise & Escalation: Serve as the primary point of escalation and subject matter expert for all complex payroll inquiries, tax processing questions, and policy matters, providing timely and accurate resolutions.

WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Experience: 10+ years of progressive, hands-on payroll experience, with a strong emphasis on managing global payroll operations for multi-country organizations.
Technical Expertise:

Deep and current knowledge of U.S. federal, state, and local payroll tax laws and regulations (including multi-state).
Extensive understanding of international payroll complexities, statutory requirements, and best practices.
Profound understanding of stock/equity compensation taxation, reporting, and disbursement.
Solid grasp of payroll accounting principles and general ledger reconciliation.

Systems Acumen: Demonstrated expertise with ADP payroll systems (including large enterprise modules like ADP WorkForce Now, GlobalView, or Celergo) and a proven track record of successful payroll system implementations, upgrades, and integrations.
Process Improvement Mindset: Proven ability to identify inefficiencies, drive process standardization, and implement automated solutions to enhance payroll accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Skills: Exceptional analytical capabilities with a keen eye for detail, coupled with strong problem-solving skills to navigate complex payroll scenarios and discrepancies.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders across all levels and functions in a global environment.
Resilience & Adaptability: Ability to thrive and deliver outstanding results in a dynamic, high-pressure, and fast-paced environment, demonstrating strong organizational and time management skills.

Proactive & Independent: Self-motivated, proactive, and capable of operating independently while also being a strong team player with a desire to contribute to collective success.

Title: Procurement Engineer (Global Supply Chain Manager)
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
 
The Procurement Engineer drives strategic cost management for select Peloton products and accessories, ensuring adherence to target costs throughout their lifecycles using a bottoms-up approach. Key responsibilities include managing the total cost of ownership (TCO), optimizing the supply chain network, and supporting product development through SPOR and dual-sourcing initiatives. Additional duties encompass complexity reduction, component phase-in/phase-out planning, and end-to-end supplier process improvements. The role also involves capital expenditure (CapEx) budget oversight and statement of work (SOW) management.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Enhance product cost competitiveness throughout the product lifecycle by optimizing total cost of ownership (TCO).


Collaborate with suppliers and engineering teams on value engineering, including:


Competitive teardowns and reverse engineering.


Should-cost and clean-sheet cost modeling.


Concept scoping and feature tradeoff analysis




Ensure product cost efficiency, supply chain scalability, and flexibility by:


Providing feature-value tradeoff recommendations.


Optimizing TCO across components and products.


Conducting value-stream mapping to reduce supply chain lead times, costs, and enhance network flexibility.




Supports the development of value engineering, cost engineering, and DfX certification programs to educate & train product development personnel with Peloton to develop & sustain products from a total cost of ownership (TCO) perspective.


Oversee cost engineering activities to align bottoms-up cost estimates with target product costs, maximizing TCO.


Manage the Supplier Plan of Record (SPOR), ensuring components are sourced on time, within budget, and to specifications through commodity management and JDM/ODM partnerships.


Control capital expenditure (CapEx) during New Product Introduction (NPI) to achieve cost-competitive outcomes.


Conduct Bill of Materials (BOM) risk assessments, identifying needs for alternate sourcing and mitigating supply chain risks.


Support complexity reduction through SKU rationalization, component commonality, and supplier consolidation.


Negotiate supplier contracts to secure favorable pricing, terms, and process improvements.


 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON


Minimum of 8 years of total professional experience, with at least 5 years in advanced sourcing activities, preferably as a commodity or sourcing manager.


Proven expertise in product-based value engineering, cost engineering, and total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis at both component and product levels.


Experience in the ODM/OEM manufacturing industry is preferred.


Background in designing and developing electronics or mechanical devices is a plus.


Bachelors degree in engineering (BSME, BSEE) or other related technical degree. Advanced technical degree or MBA strongly preferred.

While the focus of this role goes beyond traditional e-commerce analytics, youll also draw on those foundationssuch as understanding user journeys, purchase behavior, and digital conversion funnelsto inform broader strategic questions. This may include evaluating pricing dynamics, exploring tiering opportunities, and building a holistic view of what drives sustainable growth.

Analytical Execution & Insights

Conduct analysis of web and behavioral data to support key initiatives across  subscription, traffic, engagement, conversion and tiered pricing possibilities. 
Build dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs and identify trends across various funnel
Contribute to product and experimentation discussions by analyzing test results and providing data-backed recommendations
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define and measure success metrics

Partnership & Collaboration

Partner with product managers and business stakeholders to clarify goals and turn them into measurable questions
Work closely with other data teams and data engineers to ensure high-quality instrumentation and data access
Surface data quality issues or gaps in tracking and propose improvements collaboratively

Experimentation & Measurement

Support A/B and multivariate test design and post-test analysis with guidance from senior team members
Apply best practices in experiment evaluation and help ensure analytical rigor in test interpretation
Assist in maintaining and refining experimentation workflows and documentation

Communication & Storytelling

Translate analysis findings into clear insights and visualizations for stakeholders
Contribute to written summaries and presentations that connect data insights to business outcomes
Participate in team meetings and brainstorming sessions, offering ideas and contributing to a culture of learning

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Peloton is looking for a motivated, dynamic attorney with 7+ years of experience at a top law firm or in-house legal department to join our corporate legal team. As Senior Counsel, you will be primarily responsible for supporting Pelotons senior attorneys, Finance and People teams on all matters related to our public filings, securities law compliance, capital markets transactions, investor relations and Board and committee matters. 
 This role requires a strong understanding of Pelotons multifaceted business, including relationships with key stakeholders such as our members, suppliers, and partners, to help achieve our business objectives. This role will be based out of our New York City headquarters office and will be required to comply with our hybrid policy. Currently, hybrid team members report to the office weekly on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.
 
YOUR IMPACT AT PELOTON:

Serve as the main legal contact for the Financial Reporting team in preparing and reviewing SEC filings (Form 10-K, 10-Q). 
Lead preparation and analysis of proxy statements, Form 8-K, related party transactions, director and officer questionnaires, and corporate compliance calendars.
Oversee administration of Pelotons Insider Trading Policy and 10b5-1 plans, and prepare reports of beneficial ownership for officers and directors on Forms 3, 4 and 5. 
Review external communications, including press releases, investor presentations, and other announcements in collaboration with Investor Relations and Communications teams.
Draft agendas, resolutions and minutes for Board and committee meetings.
Partner with the People team on Compensation Committee agenda items and related executive compensation, equity issuances, and public reporting matters.
Stay informed on governance trends, SEC and Nasdaq regulations, and industry best practices, presenting insights to the Nominating, Governance and Corporate Responsibility Committee.
Collaborate with Investor Relations on Regulation FD compliance, investor engagement, and Pelotons annual stockholder meeting.
Support ESG initiatives, public disclosures and corporate governance matters. 
Develop and maintain policies and procedures related to securities law compliance and risk management, while working closely with internal audit on SOX compliance.
Assist Treasury and Accounting teams with credit facilities and other financing arrangements, and participate in capital markets transactions.
Handle special projects as needed, adapting to a fast-paced,evolving environment.
Build strong relationships with Legal, Finance, People and senior business teams to drive operational efficiencies.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON:

7+ years experience in SEC reporting or securities law compliance and advisory work at a top law firm and/or in-house role (in-house experience preferred).
Expertise in corporate and securities law, particularly SEC and Nasdaq rules and regulations.
Exceptional communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
Business-savvy with the ability to provide strategic legal advice.
Strong team player with a willingness to take on a range of responsibilities (no job is too small or too large).
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Member in good standing of the NY, CA, or comparable State Bar.

Title: Sr. Manager, Global Lifecycle and Engagement Marketing
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a results-oriented Senior Manager, Member Lifecycle & Engagement to play a key role in driving member engagement and brand happiness. Reporting to the Senior Director, Membership Strategy & Engagement, this leadership role will focus on executing and optimizing member communications strategies, improving member satisfaction, and ensuring alignment with broader business goals. You will lead a team that focuses on implementing effective initiatives to engage members at every touchpoint, using data-driven insights to manage an evergreen calendar, lean into automation, and drive owned channels (email, push, in-app, sms, hardware notifications). If you are passionate about lifecycle marketing, member engagement, and retention, and have proven experience executing large-scale strategies, we encourage you to apply.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead end-to-end member engagement strategy, developing impactful and data-informed lifecycle communications that foster connection and community across themember journey  from onboarding through long-term brand advocacy.
Own and evolve the member onboarding experience, partnering with Product, Content, and Creative to deliver dynamic, high-performing series that drive early activation and set the foundation for long-term engagement.
Drive channel-specific engagement strategies across Email, Push, In-App, SMS, and Hardware Notifications. Prioritize personalization, timeliness, and tone, using experimentation and automation to maximize channel impact.
Analyze and optimize engagement campaigns with a focus on how communications influence key member behaviors, including class frequency, content exploration, feature adoption, and habit formation.
Collaborate cross-functionally with Brand, Content, Creative, and Community teams to tell compelling stories that celebrate member milestones, highlight instructor-led content, and reinforce brand identity.
Lead storytelling and brand-building initiatives that spotlight real member journeys, reinforce Pelotons values, and foster a sense of belonging across diverse audiences.
Build and manage an evergreen engagement calendar, proactively surfacing key seasonal, cultural, and content moments to deepen emotional connection and excitement around Peloton's offerings.
Champion a culture of experimentation by testing new messaging formats, cadence strategies, and cross-channel engagement tactics. Leverage insights to inform creative direction and strategic planning.
Mentor and lead a high-performing engagement team, fostering professional development, collaborative thinking, and a member-first mindset. Ensure alignment around shared KPIs and team goals.
Report regularly on campaign performance and engagement health, synthesizinginsights into actionable next steps. Partner with analytics to define success metrics and evaluate impact on business and brand objectives.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5-6 years of experience in retention marketing, lifecycle/CRM roles, or similar, with a track record of managing comprehensive campaigns across digital channels such as email, SMS, and push notifications.
3-5 years of experience leading and mentoring teams, including managing and guiding direct reports to meet strategic objectives and improve performance.
Familiarity with the subscription business model and a deep understanding of the customer lifecycle. Extensive experience within the retention space.
Production and implementation of direct marketing programs across digital channels - email, SMS, in-app, push notifications. Experience with a physical hardware product a plus.
Strong working knowledge of marketing automation platforms such as Braze, Salesforce, Litmus, or similar tools. Proficiency in HTML and a deep understanding of best practices in email and digital design.
Solid understanding of data analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tableau, Excel, etc.) and ability to analyze campaign performance, derive insights from data, and adapt strategies to optimize results.
Exceptional attention to detail and a rigorous approach to measuring and improving marketing performance.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and other key stakeholders. 
Strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative, team-oriented approach to working across functions.
Proven ability to lead and inspire a cross-functional team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Demonstrated experience managing and developing a team, including mentoring junior and mid-level team members and planning for their professional growth.
Ability to navigate and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization, drivingalignment around shared goals.
